mapper.sql: id , name, gender, birthday, idCard, wedlock, nationId, nativePlace, politicId, email, phone, address, departmentId, jobLevelId, posId, engageForm, tiptopDegree, specialty, school, beginDate, workState, workID, contractTerm, conversionTime, notWorkDate, beginContract, endContract, workAge
mapper.select: select e.*, d.id did, d.name dname, n.id nid, n.name nname, pol.id polid, pol.name polname, j.id jid, j.name jname, pos.id posid, pos.name posname from employee e left join department d on e.departmentId = d.id left join nation n on e.nationId = n.id left join politicsstatus pol on e.politicId = pol.id left join joblevel j on e.jobLevelId = j.id left join position pos on e.posId = pos.id where e.id = #{id}

mapper.select:
select count(*) from employee e join department d on e.departmentId = d.id join nation n on e.nationId = n.id join politicsstatus pol on e.politicId = pol.id join joblevel j on e.jobLevelId = j.id join position pos on e.posId = pos.id
where e.name like concat('%',#{name},'%')

update employee
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

nationId = #{nationId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
nativePlace = #{nativePlace,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
politicId = #{politicId,jdbcType=INTEGER},

where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
